Class IssueViewController

java.lang.Object
controller.IssueViewController
public class IssueViewController extends Object
Controller for displaying the detailed view of a single Issue. Handles initialization of UI components, displaying issue information, managing status updates, and delegating actions such as editing or returning to the previous view to the main application window controller.
Version:
0.2
Author:
Artur Twardzik

  • Constructor Details

    • IssueViewController

      public IssueViewController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      JavaFX initialization method. Sets up tooltips, keyboard shortcuts (Ctrl/Cmd + R for back, Ctrl/Cmd + E for edit), and populates the status combo box with all possible BugStatus values.

    • updateStatus

      private void updateStatus()
      Updates the status of the currently displayed issue based on the value selected in the statusComboBox and updates the statusLabel. Also shows a toast message confirming the change.

    • assignBtnClicked

      void assignBtnClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Event handler triggered when the assign button is clicked. Currently a placeholder for future implementation of issue assignment.
      Parameters:
      event - the action event

    • backBtnClicked

      void backBtnClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Event handler triggered when the back button is clicked. Delegates the navigation to the main controller to return to the previous view.
      Parameters:
      event - the action event

    • editIssueBtnClicked

      void editIssueBtnClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Event handler triggered when the edit button is clicked. Delegates opening the current issue in edit mode to the main controller.
      Parameters:
      event - the action event

    • initializeData

      public void initializeData(Issue issue)
      Populates the issue view with data from the given Issue, including labels, WebView description, and status combo box.
      Parameters:
      issue - the issue whose details should be displayed

    • setParent

      public void setParent(MainAppWindowController mainWindow)
      Sets the parent main window controller, which provides navigation methods and access to shared application data.
      Parameters:
      mainWindow - the main application window controller
